instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 5.18v 1.38a no power
threads.message:
water damage tried clean components affected. no serious corossion.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 12.31v stable 
replaced <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> no changes
MASTER PMU LDO and BUCKS seems normal compared to working board.
noticed that <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> resistance is low compared to working board which is 0.352ohms
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> .05V 0.179ohms
any thing to do next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 5.18v 1.38a no power
threads.message:
Low resistance on <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> can be caused by accumulated crap under BGA cips powered from it.
Can also be some filter cap corroded.
